title.narrative: Indigenous rights and culture in Adivasi forest communities

description.narrative: The new Tribal Forests Rights Act gives indigenous tribes the right to exploit local forests in a sustainable manner. The execution of the law has however been incomplete. The project aims to facilitate the execution in manner that secures the tribal way o f life.Industrial development and globalization mines and old forest laws and policies are further pushing them to the margins of existence threatening their sustainable livelihood their traditional subsistence- and shifting cultivation minor forest produc e collection herbal practices and bamboo-work. In some areas they are even under threat of being uprooted/evicted or displaced from their indigenous homes and habitats. Indian government has set up institutions (like Baiga Development Authority) and specia l budgetary provisions to take care of PTGs and to address their declining population growth literacy below 5% and remote and isolated habitation etc. But due to top-down policies non-transparency in functioning and governmental inertia these measures have hardly made change in the situation. Forest Rights Act has potential to provide also for PTGs (among other tribes) tenurial security and autonomy barrier free MFP collection habitat rights and other community rights but it has not yet been adequately impl emented. The intended continuation project aims to support and capacitate 4 PTGs of Chhattisgarh (and MP) to organise themselves to secure their rights and to strengthen their communities. PTG forums workshops trainings and advocacy strengthen their unity and make them aware about their basic rights. It supports the possibilities of the PTG-communities to defend their traditional forest habitat and community rights their means of subsistence and traditional occupations and their rights to drinking water ed ucation and health care. Project aims to ensure bottom-up planning and to bring transparency in the functioning of PTGs-Development Authorities. By audio-visual and written documentation campaigning and dissemination of survey findings and newsletters the project makes wider audience aware of the situation of the PTGs and creates national and international pressure to get their rights implemented compliant to the international commitments.
